sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; import './BonusBridgeExplanation.css'; /** * Component that provides detailed explanation of the Bonus Bridge scoring system * @param {Object} props - Component props * @param {Function} props.onClose - Function to close the explanation */ const BonusBridgeExplanation = ({ onClose }) => { return (

Bonus Bridge Scoring Explained

Core Principles

  • Balance gameplay between declarers and defenders
  • Reward good defense even when contracts are made
  • Scale scores to more manageable numbers
  • Consider HCP distribution between the teams
  • Reward skill rather than just card distribution

Scoring Process for Made Contracts

Step 1: Calculate Raw Score and Reduce Scale

  • Raw Score = Standard bridge score for the contract made
  • Initial Points = Raw Score Ã· 20 (creates more manageable numbers)

Step 2: Calculate HCP Advantage

  • HCP Percentage for Declarer = (Declarer HCP / Total HCP) Ã— 100
  • HCP Percentage for Defenders = 100 - Declarer HCP Percentage
  • HCP Advantage = |Declarer HCP% - Defender HCP%|
  • Advantage Side = Declarer HCP% > 50% ? "declarer" : "defender"

Step 3: Apply HCP Adjustment Based on Contract Type

Determine Expected HCP based on contract type:

Contract Type Expected HCP
Part Scores (1-2 level) 21 HCP
3NT Game 25 HCP
4â™¥/â™  Game 24 HCP
5â™£/â™¦ Game 27 HCP
Small Slams (6 level) 30 HCP
Grand Slams (7 level) 32 HCP

Calculate adjustment:

  • Adjustment = (Declarer HCP - Expected HCP) Ã— 0.75
  • If Declarer HCP > Expected HCP: Subtract adjustment from Initial Points
  • If Declarer HCP < Expected HCP: Add adjustment to Initial Points
  • No adjustment if Declarer HCP = Expected HCP

Step 4: Calculate Expected Tricks

  • Contract Expected Tricks: 6 + contract level
  • Hand Expected Tricks: 6 + (Declarer HCP Ã· 3) + (Distribution Points Ã· 4)
  • Cap Hand Expected Tricks at 13

Step 5: Performance Assessment

For Contract Performance:

  • Performance Variance = Actual Tricks - Contract Expected Tricks
  • If Variance > 0 (overtricks): Add (Variance Ã— 1.5) points
  • If Variance < 0 (failed contract): No declarer points (see "Defeated Contracts")

For Hand Potential Performance (only if Hand Expected > Contract Expected):

  • Potential Variance = Actual Tricks - Hand Expected Tricks
  • If Potential Variance < 0 (underperformance): Subtract (|Potential Variance| Ã— 0.75) points

Step 6: Apply Contract Type Adjustments

  • For Game contracts: Add 2 points
  • For Small Slam contracts: Add 4 points
  • For Grand Slam contracts: Add 6 points
  • For NT contracts: Add 1 point
  • For contracts with 4+ overtricks: Add 1 point
  • For contracts with 7+ overtricks: Add 2 points

Step 7: Distribution Adjustment (Suit Contracts Only)

Distribution points: Void=3, Singleton=2, Doubleton=1, Long suits (6+=1-3)

  • 1-2 dist points: No deduction
  • 3-4 dist points: Deduct 1 point
  • 5-6 dist points: Deduct 2 points
  • 7+ dist points: Deduct 3 points

Step 8: Defender Reward Calculation

Only apply if ALL of the following are true:

  1. Contract is made
  2. Hand Expected Tricks > Contract Expected Tricks
  3. Actual Tricks < Hand Expected Tricks

If conditions are met:

  • Defender Reward = (Hand Expected Tricks - Actual Tricks) Ã— 2
  • Extra reward if defending at disadvantage: min(3, HCP Advantage Ã· 10)
  • Defender Points = Defender Reward + Extra Reward

Step 9: Finalize Scores

  • Declarer Final Points = Steps 1-7 result, rounded to nearest whole number
  • Defender Final Points = Step 8 result (if applicable), rounded to nearest whole number
  • Minimum declarer score for made contracts: 1 point

Scoring Process for Defeated Contracts

Step 1: Calculate Base Penalty

  • Base Penalty = |Raw Score| Ã· 10

Step 2: Add Contract Level Penalties

  • For defeated Game contracts: Add 3 points
  • For defeated Small Slams: Add 5 points
  • For defeated Grand Slams: Add 7 points

Step 3: Calculate Defender Performance Bonus

  • If Declarer HCP% > 60%: Add (Declarer HCP% - 50) Ã· 5 points
  • If contract defeated by 2+ tricks: Add 2 points
  • If contract defeated by 3+ tricks: Add 3 points

Step 4: Calculate Declarer Consolation (Optional)

  • If Declarer HCP% < 40%: Add (50 - Declarer HCP%) Ã· 10 points to declarer

Step 5: Finalize Scores

  • Defender Final Points = Base Penalty + Level Penalties + Performance Bonus, rounded to nearest whole number
  • Declarer Final Points = Consolation Points (if any), rounded to nearest whole number
  • Minimum defender score for defeated contracts: 3 points

Game Contract Definitions

  • 3NT
  • 4â™¥/â™ 
  • 5â™£/â™¦
  • Any slam (6 or 7 level)

Score Recording Guide

  1. Each team (NS and EW) records their own points separately
  2. Points are earned by both declarers AND defenders
  3. Keep a running total for each team
  4. The team with the highest total at the end wins

Example Calculations

Example 1: Made Game Contract with Strong Hand

Contract: 4â™¥ by South (NS)
Tricks Made: 10 (exactly made)
Declarer HCP: 28
Distribution Points: 4
Defender HCP: 12
Vulnerability: Non-Vulnerable

Calculation:

  1. Raw Score: 420 Ã· 20 = 21 points
  2. HCP Percentages: Declarer 70%, Defender 30%, Advantage 40% to Declarer
  3. HCP Adjustment:
    • Expected HCP for 4â™¥: 24
    • Adjustment: (28 - 24) Ã— 0.75 = 3 points subtracted â†’ 18 points
  4. Expected Tricks:
    • Contract Expected: 6 + 4 = 10 tricks
    • Hand Expected: 6 + (28 Ã· 3) + (4 Ã· 4) = 6 + 9.33 + 1 = 16.33 â†’ 13 (capped)
  5. Performance:
    • Contract Performance: 10 - 10 = 0 (exactly made)
    • Hand Potential Performance: 10 - 13 = -3 â†’ -3 Ã— 0.75 = -2.25 points â†’ 15.75 points
  6. Contract Adjustment: Game contract +2 â†’ 17.75 points
  7. Distribution: -1 for 4 distribution points â†’ 16.75 points
  8. Defender Reward: (13 - 10) Ã— 2 = 6 points + 3 (max for 40% disadvantage) = 9 points
  9. Final Scores: NS (declarer) = 17 points, EW (defender) = 9 points
); }; export default BonusBridgeExplanation;
